title: Opening CLDR Survey Tool early for DDL locales
content:
We are announcing an early submission window for the CLDR Survey Tool, exclusively for Digitally Disadvantaged Languages (DDLs). These include languages across the world that lack full digital support, such as Q ºeqchi º with about 1.3M speakers, and many more.

The early submission window will allow more time for individuals and organizations that make DDL contributions, providing crucial data to c
creator: Unicode, Inc.

title: UTC #185 Highlights
content:
Unicode Technical Committee meeting #185 was held October 27 ‚Äì 29 in Cupertino, CA, hosted by Apple. Here are some highlights.

Starting the Unicode 18.0 cycle
As we've been following an annual September release cycle for the Unicode Standard, the Q4 UTC meeting is the first meeting during a new cycle. While some decisions targeting the release might have been taken at a previous meeting, this is
creator: Unicode, Inc.

title: Introducing the Unicode Inflection Library Technical Preview Release
content: The problem of linguistic inflection has long been a barrier to effective software internationalization. The problem is even more visible today with multimodal UIs. In many languages, word forms change (inflect) based on grammatical context, creating a significant challenge for developers aiming to build truly global applications. Getting the wrong word inflection can be as bad as using the wrong
creator: Unicode, Inc.

title: Unicode CLDR 48 available
content:
Unicode CLDR 48 is now available and has been integrated into version 78 of ICU.¬†


  Some of the most significant changes in this release are the following (for more detail, see the CLDR 48 release note page):

Updated for Unicode 17, including new names and search terms for new emoji, new sort order, and Han‚ÜíLatin romanization additions for many characters.

Updated to the latest external standa
creator: Unicode, Inc.

title: ICU4X 2.1 released!
content:
The ICU4X Technical Committee is happy to announce ICU4X 2.1, an update to our modular, portable, and secure i18n library.

ICU4X is Unicode's modern, lightweight, portable, and secure i18n library. Built from the ground up, its binary size and memory usage footprint is 50-90% smaller than ICU4C. It is memory-safe, written in Rust with interfaces into C++, JavaScript, Dart, TypeScript ‚Äî with other
creator: Unicode, Inc.

title: Unicode CLDR 48 Beta available for specification review
content:
The Unicode CLDR 48 Beta is now available for specification review and integration testing. The release is planned for October 29th, 2025, but any feedback on the specification needs to be submitted well in advance of that date. The beta specification is available at Draft LDML Modifications. See also the Migration section of the new release page.

creator: Unicode, Inc.

title: Unicode 17.0 Release Announcement
content:
Announcing The Unicode¬Æ Standard, Version 17.0


The Unicode Standard is the foundation for all global digital communications, providing the encoding for text content used in all devices. The latest version of the standard, Version 17.0, is now available! This is a major update that includes new characters and code charts, updated data files, an updated Core Specification, and updated annexes and
creator: Anonymous

title: Highlights from UTC Meeting #184
content:
The Unicode Technical Committee (UTC) meeting #184 was held last week, July 22 ‚Äì 24, in Redmond, Washington, hosted by Microsoft. Here are some highlights.
Finalizing Unicode 17.0

creator: Anonymous

title: ICU4X 2.0 released!
content:
At the intersection of human and computer languages, internationalization (i18n) continues to play a pivotal role in modern software. Evolving i18n libraries means better quality experiences, improved performance, and support for digitally disadvantaged languages.

ICU4X is Unicode's modern, lightweight, portable, and secure i18n library. Built from the ground up, its binary size and memory usage
creator: Unicode, Inc.

title: Unicode 17.0 Beta Review Open
content:
The beta review period for Unicode¬Æ 17.0 has started and is open until July 1, 2025.

The beta is intended primarily for review of character property data and changes to algorithm specifications (Unicode Standard Annexes and certain Unicode Technical Standards that are synchronized with the Unicode Standard). Also, a complete draft of the core specification text is available for review during the
creator: Unicode, Inc.

All major browsers and all modern mobile phones use CLDR for language support.

title: ICU 77 Now Available!
content:
Unicode¬Æ ICU 77 has just been released. ICU is the premier library for software internationalization, used by a wide array of companies and organizations to support the world's languages, implementing both the latest version of the Unicode Standard and of the Unicode locale data (CLDR).

ICU 77 updates to CLDR 47 (beta blog) locale data with new locales, and various additions and corrections.

creator: Unicode, Inc.

content:
Unicode CLDR 47 Release:
MessageFormat 2.0 Stable

CLDR 47 is now available and has been integrated into version 77 of ICU. The CLDR 47 release page has information on accessing the data, reviewing charts of the changes, and ‚Äî importantly ‚Äî Migration issues including upcoming changes planned in CLDR 48.

creator: Unicode, Inc.

title: Support for the New Saudi Riyal Currency Symbol
content: In February of this year, the Saudi Central Bank (SAMA) announced the creation of a new symbol to represent the Saudi riyal currency. This was widely noticed by users, font developers and other vendors, and many are wondering how it should be supported. The Unicode Consortium has received a number of inquiries regarding this. In this blog post, we want to let you know about our plans for supportin
creator: Unicode, Inc.
